item.title: Sensors in Robotics: How Ultrasonic, LiDAR, and IMU Work
item.description: Sensors are to robots what eyes, ears, and skin are to humansâ€”but with far fewer limits. While we rely on just five senses, robots can be equipped with many more, sensing distances, movement, vibrations, orientation, light intensity, and even chemical properties. These sensors form the bridge between the digital intelligence of a robot and the physical world it operates in.
